doc.after: In differential geometry a branch of mathematics a volume form on a differentiable manifold is a differential form of top degree i e whose degree is equal to the dimension of the manifold that is nowhere equal to zero A manifold has a volume form if and only if it is orientable An orientable manifold has infinitely many volume forms since multiplying a volume form by a non vanishing function yields another volume form On non orientable manifolds one may instead define the weaker notion of a density Integrating the volume form gives the volume of the manifold according to that form
